Reason: The QUALITY configuration option in the batik software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact the rendering quality of images. Higher quality settings may require more computational resources and memory, leading to longer execution times and increased memory consumption. On the other hand, lower quality settings may result in faster rendering but with reduced image quality. Therefore, the QUALITY configuration option directly affects system performance and should be carefully tuned to achieve the desired balance between quality and performance.
